text:
# 2025 GENERAL SPORTS OFFER PRODUCT FACT FILE ![img-0.jpeg](img-0.jpeg) > The image shows a rhythmic gymnast in mid-performance. The gymnast is wearing a sparkling, intricately designed leotard in shades of pink and nude, adorned with sequins and rhinestones. The gymnast's head is obscured by a large, glittery pink ball, which is a piece of rhythmic gymnastics equipment. The gymnast's arms are extended gracefully, and one leg is bent at the knee, suggesting a dynamic and elegant pose. The background is a plain, light beige color, keeping the focus on the gymnast and the ball. ![img-1.jpeg](img-1.jpeg) > The image contains text with a black and white color scheme. The top portion has a black background with the year "2025" written in large white numbers. Below this, on a white background, the text reads "GENERAL S" in bold black letters, followed by "PRODUCT FACT FIL" in smaller black letters. The text appears to be part of a title or heading, possibly from a document or presentation related to product information for the year 2025. # 2025 SPORTS FEED SERVICE PRODUCT FACT FILE # SPORTS FEED SERVICE ## EDITORIAL FORMAT - A real-time sports news feed - Production available in 6 languages: French, English, German, Spanish, Arabic and Portuguese - Hourly coverage: 24/7, in real time - Non-regionalised feed | Description | Sports coverage | | --- | --- | | Sports events | Football, cycling, cricket, Formula 1, rugby, tennis, athletics, basketball, golf, handball, swimming and much more… | | Sports extras | Football, cycling, cricket, Formula 1, rugby, tennis, athletics, basketball, golf, handball, swimming and much more… | ## *Ratio per language for annual production in 2024** ![img-2.jpeg](img-2.jpeg) > The image shows a pie chart illustrating the distribution of 292 stories per day (excluding updates) across six languages. The percentages for each language are as follows: > > - French: 35% (represented in dark blue) > - English: 20% (represented in red) > - German: 16% (represented in purple) > - Spanish: 14% (represented in orange) > - Arabic: 10% (represented in light blue) > - Portuguese: 5% (represented in yellow) > > The number "292*" is prominently displayed on the left side of the image, indicating the total stories per day. The asterisk likely denotes a note or condition related to the data. | SUBSCRIPTION | DELIVERY METHODS | | --- | --- | | Monthly subscription | Via satellite or FTP for direct integration into the customer's system API AFP News | | New | *Average volume from January to December 2024 **Average over one year, given as an indication, likely to vary according to current events | # 2025 ## SID SPORTS TEXT SERVICE PRODUCT FACT FILE # SID SPORTS TEXT Service ## EDITORIAL FORMAT - Aimed at a German-speaking media, corporate and institutional clientele living mainly in Germany or in Europe and looking for rich coverage of sports news. - German correspondents present in Paris, Brussels, Washington, Istanbul. - Hourly coverage: 24/7 in real time. ## COVERAGE - Rich coverage of sports relating to themes: football, tennis, athletics, etc. - Sporting information managed by the SID office based in Cologne, aimed primarily at a German-speaking clientele looking for German sports news in real time. - Focus on German sports and the performance of German athletes. - The feed also covers other sports as well as the main national and special events ![img-3.jpeg](img-3.jpeg) ## COVERAGE DETAIL** - Athletics - Basketball - Cyclism - Handball - Motor sports - Ski - Football - Tennis - Olympics ## PRODUCT FORMATS - Delivery of metadata: XML, NewsML and jpg, if the story includes photos. ## SUBSCRIPTION - Monthly subscription to the complete feed or to a selection within the feed ## DELIVERY METHODS - FTP or satellite - AFP - Forum - SIDForum - API *Average volume from January to December 2024 **Average over one year, given as an indication, likely to vary according to current events # 2025 ## SPORTING INFORMATION FEED IN ARABIC (ARB SPORT) PRODUCT FACT FILE # SPORTING INFORMATION FEED IN ARABIC ## "ARB SPORT" EDITION ### EDITORIAL FORMAT - Aimed at Arabic-speaking customers interested in world and regional sports news. - Validated by the Nicosia desk. - AFP has Arabic-speaking sports editors writing in Arabic, present in all countries of the region. - Hourly coverage: 6am to 10pm GMT, 7 days a week, in real time. ### COVERAGE - Rich coverage of sports relating to themes: football, tennis, athletics, motor racing sports, etc. - The feed also covers other sports as well as the main special, national and international (football World Cup, etc.) events. | Forecasts | Time (GMT) > The image is a pie chart showing the distribution of different sports categories by percentage. The categories and their corresponding percentages are as follows: > > - Football: 57% (largest segment, colored blue) > - Olympics: 8% (colored red) > - Tennis: 7% (colored orange) > - Ski: 6% (colored light green) > - Motor sports: 6% (colored purple) > - Basketball: 6% (colored black) > - Handball: 5% (colored yellow) > - Cyclism: 3% (colored gray) > - Athletics: 2% (colored light blue) > > The chart visually emphasizes that football dominates the distribution with more than half of the total percentage. | DELIVERY METHODS | | --- | --- | --- | | "Sports forecast menu" | 11:30am | Forecasts on ARB Sport service themes: football, athletics, tennis, basketball. | ### Coverage details** ![img-4.jpeg](img-4.jpeg) | PRODUCT FORMATS | SUBSCRIPTION | DELIVERY METHODS | | --- | --- | --- | | NewsML-G2, IIM, NewsML-1.1, ANPA | Monthly subscription to the full service or to the section. | API Satellite or FTP AFP News | **Average volume from January to December 2024* **Average over one year, given as an indication, likely to vary according to current events* # 2025 SPORTS PHOTO SERVICE PRODUCT FACT FILE # SPORTS PHOTO SERVICE ## EDITORIAL FORMAT - Pictures captioned in English and classified according to IPTC norms. - The number of pictures can reach 1,200 per day during weekends or for major special events. - Coverage: 24/7, in real-time ## Sports coverage Sports events Sports extras ## Description Football, cycling, cricket, Formula 1, rugby, tennis, athletics, basketball, golf, handball, swimming and much more... Sporting Institutions (IOC, FIFA, federations, clubs, athletes, sponsors) > The image consists of two main parts: a textual statistic on the left and a pie chart on the right. > > On the left side, there is a large orange number "30*" followed by the text "Reports per day (excluding updates)" in black. > > On the right side, there is a pie chart divided into six colored segments, each representing a different sport category with corresponding percentages: > > - Athletics (purple) - 2% > - Basketball (light blue) - 7% > - Motor sports (orange) - 8% > - Football (dark blue) - 67% > - Tennis (red) - 7% > - Olympics (yellow) - 9% > > The largest segment by far is Football, making up 67% of the reports per day. The smallest segment is Athletics at 2%. The other categories range between 7% and 9%. The colors of the segments correspond to the legend listed next to the pie chart. . Other themes relating to sport such as doping, justice, people, etc. ## Coverage details** ![img-5.jpeg](img-5.jpeg) PRODUCT FORMATS - Image size via satellite: 1.5 MB - Image size via FTP: - 1.5 MB - Formats via AFP Forum: 512 pixels, 768 pixels or original size - 800 KB for Africa SUBSCRIPTION - One-shot sales - Quota, with or without over quota - Photo feed (annual subscription) > The image consists of two main parts: a large number on the left and a pie chart on the right. > > On the left side, the number "1,490*" is prominently displayed in large blue font, with the text "photos per day" written below it in smaller black font. > > On the right side, there is a pie chart divided into segments representing different sports categories. Each segment is color-coded and labeled with a percentage. The legend next to the pie chart identifies the colors and their corresponding sports: > > - Athletics (orange) - 3% > - Basketball (black) - 2% > - Cricket (red) - 7% > - Cyclism (yellow) - 4% > - Motor sports (purple) - 9% > - Rugby (light green) - 3% > - Football (blue) - 39% > - Tennis (light blue) - 11% > - Olympics (gray) - 22% > > The largest segment is Football at 39%, followed by Olympics at 22%, Tennis at 11%, and Motor sports at 9%. The smallest segments are Basketball at 2% and Rugby and Athletics each at 3%. ## DELIVERY METHODS - Regionalised feeds available via satellite or FTP - API - AFP News # 2025 INFOGRAPHICS & VIDEOGRAPHICS SPORTS ## PRODUCT FACT FILE ![img-6.jpeg](img-6.jpeg) > The image features a logo on a yellow background. The logo consists of the text "AFP" in blue, followed by a solid blue circle, and then the word "Sports" in black. The overall design is simple and uses bold colors for contrast. # SPORTS INFOGRAPHICS & VIDEOGRAPHICS SERVICE ## SPORTS INFOGRAPHICS ### EDITORIAL FORMAT - Graphics combining information, images and data - Production available in 6 languages: French, English, Arabic, Spanish, German and Portuguese | Sports coverage | Description | | --- | --- | | Sports events | Systematic coverage of major Sports events: football World cup and Champions’ League, Olympic Summer and Winter Games, Tour de France, Formula One presentation On merit coverage of major sports development: record breaking, sport legends career summary… | | Sports extras | Explainer on new technologies and innovations in sports, on doping issues… | ### *Ratio per language for annual production in 2024** ![img-7.jpeg](img-7.jpeg) | PRODUCT FORMATS | SUBSCRIPTION | DELIVERY METHODS | | --- | --- | --- | | .AI .PNG (standard or retina) .JPEG (standard or retina) .PDF EPS .JPEG | One-shot sales Quota, with or without over-quota Infographics feed (annual subscription) > The image consists of two main parts: > > 1. On the left side, there is a large yellow number "6*" with the text "Infographics per day" written below it in black. > > 2. On the right side, there is a pie chart divided into five colored segments, each representing a different language and its percentage share: > - Yellow segment labeled "German" accounts for 24%. > - Purple segment labeled "English" accounts for 24%. > - Light blue segment labeled "Spanish" accounts for 21%. > - Orange segment labeled "French" accounts for 16%. > - Dark blue segment labeled "Portuguese" accounts for 15%. > > The pie chart visually shows the distribution of infographics per day by language. Also available via Online News via FTP for direct integration | Regionalised feeds available via satellite or FTP API AFP News | **Average volume from January to December 2024* **Average over one year, given as an indication, likely to vary according to current events like Olympics* # SPORTS INFOGRAPHICS & VIDEOGRAPHICS SERVICE ## SPORTS VIDEOGRAPHICS ### EDITORIAL FORMAT - Videographics combine text, images, video and 3D modelling elements with audio voice-over and a separate dopesheet - Formats dedicated to digital and audiovisual media: TV, online editors, mobiles, tablets, public screens… Available in 6 languages: English, Spanish, French, German, Arabic, and Portuguese - Separate audio voice-over and script - Ready to publish format or editable format for translation and integration into your story. | Sports coverage | Description | | --- | --- | | Sports events | Systematic coverage of special events: Winter and Summer Olympic Games, FIFA World Cup | | Sports extras | Focus on new technologies and innovations in sports, including in Formula 1 | ### *Ratio per language for annual production in 2024** ![img-8.jpeg](img-8.jpeg) > The image consists of two main parts: > > 1. On the left side, there is a large yellow number "75*" with the text "videographics per year" written below it in black. > > 2. On the right side, there is a pie chart divided into five colored segments representing different languages and their respective percentages: > - Light blue segment labeled "German" accounts for 4%. > - Orange segment labeled "English" accounts for 27%. > - Blue segment labeled "Spanish" accounts for 28%. > - Yellow segment labeled "French" accounts for 16%. > - Red segment labeled "Portuguese" accounts for 25%. > > The pie chart visually shows the distribution of videographics per year by language, with Spanish having the largest share, followed by English, Portuguese, French, and German. ## PRODUCT FORMATS - JPEG - Adobe Flash [16:9] 640x360 (.f4v) - MPEG4 H.264 [16:9] 1280x720 (.mp4) - MPEG4 H.264 [16:9] 640x360 (.mp4) - MPEG2 [4:3] 720x576 (.mp2) - One-shot sales - Quota, with or without over-quota - Videographics feed (annual subscription) - Also available via Online News via FTP for direct integration ## DELIVERY METHODS - Regionalised feeds available via satellite or FTP - API - AFP News **Average volume from January to December 2024** **Average over one year, given as an indication, likely to vary according to current events like Olympics** # 2025 SPORTS DATA FEED PRODUCT FACT FILE # SPORTS DATA FEED ## EDITORIAL FORMAT ## The largest catalogue of sports data More than 2,000 streams of sporting results covered per year Sporting data and performance statistics on the main matches and all competitions in real time Reliable, accurate and timely feeds, suitable for all types of media Available in 18 languages including French, English, German, Spanish, Italian, Chinese and Portuguese Other languages available | Sports coverage | Description | | :-- | :-- | | Football | Domestic leagues, international cups, European
competitions | | Formula 1 | World championship | | Cycling | World championship | | Rugby | World Cup, Top 14, Pro D2, Champions Cup, 6 Nations | | Basketball | NBA, Euroleague, Europe Cup, EuroCup, World Cup | | Olympic Games | Summer and Winter Games | | Tennis | ATP / WTA, Billie Jean King Cup and Davis Cup | | Athletics | World Athletics meetings, World Championships, Diamond
League | | Volleyball | Women's and Men's European Volleyball Championships | PRODUCT FORMATS SUBSCRIPTION DELIVERY METHODS XML JSON One or several competitions / sports. One-off events (one-shot) Widgets Via API, for optimal integration Database-to-database replication # 2025 AFPTV SPORTS FR \& EN PRODUCT FACT FILE # AFPTV SPORTS IN FRENCH ## EDITORIAL FORMAT - Raw images with or without sound. - Fully edited video reports - Video length: from 30 seconds to 4 minutes / profiles and features : up to 10 minutes - Intended for broadcasters, production companies and other media - Product to be edited by the client ## COVERAGE - News and big competitions - Press conferences, training sessions, fan reactions, business, etc. - European football championships (Ligue 1, Liga, EPL), Champions League, Europa League (final) - Special events: Football World Cup, Olympic and Paralympic Games... - Red Bull Media House provides editorial content on a wide range of sporting disciplines from racing to esports and extreme sports in various locations around the world: 250 photos and 15 videos per month - Original reports and illustrative images | SLUG | Product | Edited sequences | Voice-over | Sound bite dubbing | Extra rushes | Script | Editable sequences | Sepxounds

ready-to-use articles ## EDITORIAL FORMAT - Automatic integration of articles into the client's site: - Integration of articles in real time in chronological order for easy and complete online access - Customised content integration to suit the client's content and upload preferences - Multiple editorial and technical formats for optimised adaptation to all digital media: web and mobile sites, public screens and any other interactive information medium and connected TV. ## ADDED VALUE - Productivity gains for media departments for non-core topics, thanks to instant publication of content and continuous feed to web and mobile sites - Sections adapted to suit each production language - Unique metadata to index and reference each news story ## AVAILABLE I ANGUAGES - Service available in 9 languages: French, English, German, Spanish, Arabic, Portuguese, simplified and traditional Chinese. 108 *Articles illustrated per day (all languages) > The image contains three black rectangular sections with white italic text, separated by thin vertical lines. The text in each section reads as follows: > > 1. "Coverage 24 hours a day 7 days a week" > 2. "+ 300* editable videos per month" > 3.
